intro: Manettia coccocypseloides var. glabrior, commonly known as the glabrous manettia, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and smooth, glabrous leaves. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
